content:
Diagnosis:
Metastatic small cell carcinoma of pancreas with liver and lung metastases
FGFR2 fusion positive
Stage T3N2M1

Previous treatment:
Cisplatin/Etoposide completed March 2024 - 6 cycles
Partial response initially but subsequent progression

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg bd
Dexamethasone 4mg od
Lansoprazole 30mg od

Current situation:
Progressive disease on CT 15 April 2024
New liver lesions and enlarging lung metastases
CA19-9 rising from 450 to 890

Treatment plan:
Commencing Pemigatinib 13.5mg daily based on FGFR2 fusion status
Discussed with molecular tumour board 18 April 2024
Patient understands potential side effects including hyperphosphatemia and eye toxicity

I reviewed [redacted name] today following CT showing disease progression. Performance status remains 1 with stable weight and good appetite. Main symptoms are mild right upper quadrant discomfort and occasional dry cough. Examination shows no new concerns.

We have discussed the role of targeted therapy with Pemigatinib given the presence of FGFR2 fusion. [redacted name] understands this is a newer treatment approach with monitoring requirements including regular phosphate levels and ophthalmology review. We will commence treatment next week following baseline eye examination.

Plan:
Baseline ophthalmology assessment arranged for 22 April 2024
Commence Pemigatinib 13.5mg daily from 24 April 2024
Weekly blood tests including phosphate levels
CT assessment after 8 weeks
Review in clinic in 2 weeks with blood results
